author: Special Correspondent
text:
The revenue and police officials on Monday conducted enquiries with various persons, including bank officials in connection with the sighting of a large number of bands used to tie currency notes in banks which were dumped in a bush near Golden Rock.

On information by the local people, they had visited the spot near the Armoury Gate here and found a large number of the bands.

Dumped

A police officer, who conducted enquiry, said that the labels might have been dumped by a private company, which had been licensed to load currency notes into the Automated Teller Machines of various banks.
title: Officials, police quiz banks
